com.jwillians.jweb

Class JWTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jwillians.jweb.JWTag

  • public class JWTag
extends Object
    A JWTag is an HTML element.
    Author:
    EricsonWRP

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String doctype
      The default HTML 5 doctype.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JWTag(String tag)
      The simplest constructor.
      JWTag(String tag, org.javatuples.Pair<String,String> attribute)
      It builds a tag with no content, with a simple attribute.
      JWTag(String tag, org.javatuples.Pair<String,String>[] attributes)
      It builds a simple tag with no content, but with more than one attribute (A good example of this is an img tag).
      JWTag(String tag, String content)
      It builds a simple tag with a content.
      JWTag(String tag, String content, org.javatuples.Pair<String,String> attribute)
      It builds a tag with a content and a simple attribute.
      JWTag(String tag, String content, org.javatuples.Pair<String,String>[] attributes)
      It builds a tag with content and more than one attribute.

    • Field Detail

      • doctype

        public static String doctype
        The default HTML 5 doctype.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JWTag

        public JWTag(String tag)
        The simplest constructor. It builds an empty tag (For example: "<h1></h1>").
        Parameters:
        tag - The name of the tag, such as "h1" or "p".

      • JWTag

        public JWTag(String tag,
             String content)
        It builds a simple tag with a content.
        Parameters:
        tag - The name of the tag, such as "h1" or "p".
        content - The content of the tag (For example: "<h1>content</h1>")

      • JWTag

        public JWTag(String tag,
             String content,
             org.javatuples.Pair<String,String> attribute)
        It builds a tag with a content and a simple attribute.
        Parameters:
        tag - The name of the tag, such as "h1" or "p".
        content - The content of the tag (For example: "<h1>content</h1>")
        attribute - A simple attribute as a Pair tuple.

        An attribute is comprised of two Strings, such as in: "<h1 style="color: red">content</h1>", where "style" is the first String, and its value the second one (Thus, a pair).

      • JWTag

        public JWTag(String tag,
             org.javatuples.Pair<String,String> attribute)
        It builds a tag with no content, with a simple attribute.
        Parameters:
        tag - The name of the tag, such as "h1" or "p".
        attribute - A simple attribute as a Pair tuple.

        An attribute is comprised of two Strings, such as in: "<h1 style="color: red">content</h1>", where "style" is the first String, and its value the second one (Thus, a pair).

      • JWTag

        public JWTag(String tag,
             String content,
             org.javatuples.Pair<String,String>[] attributes)
        It builds a tag with content and more than one attribute.
        Parameters:
        tag - The name of the tag, such as "h1" or "p".
        content - The content of the tag (For example: "<h1>content</h1>")
        attributes - An array of attributes as Pair tuple objects.

        An attribute is comprised of two Strings, such as in: "<h1 style="color: red">content</h1>", where "style" is the first String, and its value the second one (Thus, a pair).

      • JWTag

        public JWTag(String tag,
             org.javatuples.Pair<String,String>[] attributes)
        It builds a simple tag with no content, but with more than one attribute (A good example of this is an img tag).
        Parameters:
        tag - The name of the tag, such as "h1" or "p".
        attributes - An array of attributes as Pair tuple objects.

        An attribute is comprised of two Strings, such as in: "<h1 style="color: red">content</h1>", where "style" is the first String, and its value the second one (Thus, a pair).
